definition: to take part in/to participate/to join/to attend/to counsel/unequal/varied/irregular/uneven/not uniform/abbr. for 參議院|参议院 Senate, Upper House

sentences.english: The text is a sane conversation with millions of participants.
sentences.chinese: 文本是一次與無數參與者的理智交談。

sentences.english: Beaverton's % Mayor Doyle wants refugee and immigrant leaders to participate in the town's decision-making.
sentences.chinese: 比弗頓市長道爾希望難民和移民領袖參與本市的決策。

sentences.english: More than 2,000 women aged 18-34 were  interviewed for the poll.
sentences.chinese: 共有兩千多名18歲至34歲的女性參與了該項調查。

sentences.english: All participants were given a series of questions about the true self.
sentences.chinese: 所有參與者都要回答有關真實的自我的一系列問題。

sentences.english: Will men participate more in household duties?
sentences.chinese: 男性會更多地參與家務勞動嗎？

sentences.english: Mr. Ayers is not involved in my campaign.
sentences.chinese: 艾爾斯沒有參與我的任何競選活動。

sentences.english: Since hiring more staff for these occasions was costly, the centres needed parents to attend.
sentences.chinese: 由於再僱傭員工將很費錢，這些中心需要家長的參與。

sentences.english: Mobilize the whole society to participate in a wide range of development, needs for mobilizing the masses.
sentences.chinese: 發動全社會廣泛的參與發展，需要進行羣衆動員。

sentences.english: Do you agree that only elected District Council members should take part in the election?
sentences.chinese: 是否贊成只由民選區議員參與互選？

sentences.english: All exhibitors are welcome to take part in the International Competition and Awarding held by the organizer.
sentences.chinese: 所有參展方均可參與西安世園會國際競賽及評獎。

sentences.english: They are concerned with the training curriculum, but not the details of each course.
sentences.chinese: 他們參與培訓課程，但是並不關心每一門課程的細節。

sentences.english: Yost was an engineer involved in the development of high-altitude weather balloons.
sentences.chinese: 約斯特是一名工程師參與制訂高空氣象氣球。

sentences.english: The Slow Year Movement is becoming increasingly popular.
sentences.chinese: “慢活運動”正在全球吸引越來越多的參與者。

sentences.english: Participate facility and equipment upgrades to improve plant productivity and throughput.
sentences.chinese: 參與升級廠房設施與設備以提高產率產量。

sentences.english: Women, for instance, make up only 13% of contributors.
sentences.chinese: 再比方說女性在參與者中，僅佔了13%的比例。

sentences.english: And what do those visiting Karneval dress up as? Everything imaginable.
sentences.chinese: 看看這些科隆狂歡節參與者的打扮，發揮你的想象吧。

definition: to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to advance/to conduct/underway/in progress/to do/to carry out/to carry on/to execute
to pass through/to penetrate/by means of/via
the scene (of a crime, accident etc)/(on) the spot/(at) the site
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
to extend/to spread/to popularize/generalization/promotion (of a product etc)
by means of/through/via/to pass through/to get through/to adopt/to pass (a bill or inspection etc)/to switch over
